titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: The Delaware Humanities Forum exists to help connect the people of Delaware with other people, cultures, and ideas. To accomplish that goal, the Forum hosts free lectures and discussions to non-profit organizations, the public, and school children; provides public historical education through reenactments and traveling exhibits; sponsors lectures by scholars; provides grants to visiting scholars, scholars in residence, and to other non-profits hosting their own humanities programming. The Forum was formed in 1973. It is governed by a 27-member board of directors, and is run by a small professional staff. Rona G. Finkelstein received her Ph.D. from the University of Rochester. She joined the faculty at Delaware State College in 1964, becoming chairman of the philosophy department the following year. In 1971, she taught in the Delaware Technical and Community College parallel program, with the University of Delaware, and in 1972, became executive director of the Delaware Humanities Forum, retiring from this position in 1980.

scopecontent.p: The Delaware Humanities Forum collection consists of material dating from 1972-1995. The collection contains printed and ephemeral material related to the Forum, including programs, reports, study guides, speaker's bureau lists, flyers, posters, transcripts for Forum radio commentaries, bookmarks, and brochures. The collection also includes proposals and reports to the National Endowment for the Humanities on programs of the Delaware Humanities Council (1972-1980).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An online finding aid is available at http://www.lib.udel.edu/ud/spec/findaids/delhum.htm.
